#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Green candidate Marija Minic , York Centre
#Text=Monday , September 17 , 2007
#Text=Marija Minic is running for the Green Party of Ontario in the Ontario provincial election , in the York Centre riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed her regarding her values , her experience , and her campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?

#Text=I have chosen to involve myself in the political process because I am a conservation biologist by trade , therefore I ’m passionate about the environment and its limited resources , and I am also passionate about social justice .
#Text=I feel that I would have much more of a positive effect if I got involved politically than by doing research and writing reports which will only be read by those in the field .
#Text=I chose to run in this constituency because I am in the riding often for work , and feel that locally , there needs a lot to be done .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?

#Text=Although I have no prior political experience , apart from running for secondary school student council , I feel I have a lot of energy , knowledge and passion to bring to the position of an elected representative .
#Text=I am a hard worker and enjoying listening to , learning from and working with people from all backgrounds and walks of life .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=The Liberal incumbent , Monte Kwinter , has a great deal of experience , having been a Member of Provincial Parliament for many years .
#Text=However , I have youth , energy and a great deal of passion on my side as desirable qualities of all the candidates .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=The top three issues are education , the environment and healthcare for voters in York Centre riding .
#Text=These also happen to be the top three issues that are most important to me .

#Text=I would push for a single , publicly-funded school system , preventative healthcare , bringing back Branson Hospital to fully function as a hospital ( not just a clinic ) , and implement much tougher legislation on renewable energy and greenhouse gas emissions .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Tougher legislations on greenhouse gas emissions should be the first order of business , in my opinion .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=I do n’t believe that property taxes are at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality .
#Text=I would push for “ tax shifting ” away from income and property and onto the big polluters and resource users , according to the “ polluter-pays-principle ” .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=If sustainability ( not just in the environmental sense ) is taken into account in all provincial legislation , more jobs would be created and less would be lost .

#Text=Also , if money is more wisely and efficiently spent on elementary , secondary and tertiary education as well as job training , students would benefit from having the proper skills to enter the workforce and succeed in it .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I feel that mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) is a fairer system that works well in countries like New Zealand .
#Text=I feel that Ontario should adopt this system for future elections .
#Text=What role , if any , does " new media " play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=“ New media ” has definitely allowed for reaching out to a wider audience which was not earlier possible .
#Text=It is definitely beneficial to the campaign !
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?

#Text=To the people of the province of Ontario as a whole , the many promises Premier Dalton McGuinty has broken has been most harmful to us , as well as members of York Centre riding , including those of not phasing out coal and nuclear plants by the originally stated dates .
#Text=Also , the closing down of Branson Hospital has hit the people of York Centre riding hard .
#Text=Some of the environmental legislations implemented by the 38th Legislative Assembly have been beneficial , but could definitely be improved upon .
#Text=This is why I encourage you to vote for the Green Party of Ontario in the upcoming election on October 10 , 2007 .
